article:
The following is a 'list of [[halftime show]]s held at the [[National Football
League]]'s championship game, the [[Super Bowl]]'. While halftime shows are a
tradition during football games at all levels of competition, the Super Bowl
halftime show represents a fundamental link to pop culture, which helps broaden
the television audience and nationwide interest.

In most years since the mid-1980s, the halftime show of the Super Bowl has
featured popular recording artists and other well-known celebrities. It has
measurably increased television viewers during and after the halftime show. Campbell (1995), pp. 14â16 The performance
is regarded one of the most-watched events in American television annually with
over 100 million viewers in the United States alone. Musical genres over the
years have represented a broad range of music types, including pop, rock,
classic rock, country, hip hop, rap, blues, and soul. In some years, short skits
or drama scenes are acted out on a stage. The performance group Up with People
has performed at the most Super Bowl halftime shows, starring in four during the
1970s and 1980s.

According to Nielsen ratings, Super Bowl XLVI halftime show headlined by Madonna
in 2012 remains the most-watched halftime show in history, with 114 million
viewers or about 3 million more than the actual
game. It is listed on the [[Guinness World
Records]] as the largest TV audience for a Super Bowl half-time
performance. Beyonce's 2013 halftime show performance was the second
most viewed show in history.
